descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course looks at the ranges of possibilities and practices within Chicana/ Latina feminisms. It looks at the conditions of oppression and the creative and expressive responses to those conditions, focusing especially on self-representation and auto-ethnography.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? describe the conditions and tensions of conciencia or the moment of being "woke" through a variety of social science theories
? describe the range of hegemonic conditions that pressure Chicanas and Latinas to align with a majoritarian stance
? describe and explain a range of conundrums or costs in rejecting subordinate positions
? describe and theorize the range of creative responses to self-representation
? describe and provide some theoretical insights into contemporary protests, social media campaigns, and unlikely locations of expressing Chicana/Latina feminisms.
